snippet: The deaths of Maodo Kane and Aboubacar Bah raise the specter of the 1990s, when dozens of drivers were killed in a single year and many others were attacked.
abstract: Killings of livery cab drivers Maodo Kane and Aboubacar Bah in the Bronx draw outcry from livery drivers, who worry that they face more danger than yellow cab operators because they serve poor, crime-ridden neighborhoods; deaths raise specter of the 1990s, when dozens of drivers were killed on the job in a single year and many others were assaulted or robbed.

byline.original: By WINNIE HU and NATE SCHWEBER

lead_paragraph: The deaths of Maodo Kane and Aboubacar Bah raise the specter of the 1990s, when dozens of drivers were killed in a single year and many others were attacked.

headline.main: Livery Drivers Are on Edge After Two Killings This Month in the Bronx
headline.print_headline: Livery Drivers Are on Edge After Two Killings This Month in the Bronx

keywords.value: New York State Federation of Taxi Drivers
keywords.name: organizations
